name: CVE-2014-4113
description: win32k.sys in the kernel-mode drivers in Microsoft Windows Server 2003 SP2, Windows Vista SP2, Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2, and Windows RT Gold and 8.1 allows local users to gain privileges via a crafted application, as exploited in the wild in October 2014, aka "Win32k.sys Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability."
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_rt:-:gold:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2012:-:gold:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2012:r2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_8.1:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2008:r2:sp1:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7:-:sp1:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2003:*:sp2:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_rt_8.1:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_vista:*:sp2:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_8:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2008:*:sp2:*:*:*:*:*:*')]
